description: Before the shepherds take their flocks of sheep to the pasture, there are 100 hectares of grass available.
Given the current situation, if each shepherd take more than 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture, consuming 10 hectares of grass, the available grass in the pasture will decrease next month
Emma took 17 flocks of sheep to the pasture, thus consuming 17 hectares of grass.

The mayor presented the monthly pasture report, with John, Kate, and Emma agreeing to reduce the number of flocks they bring to the pasture next month to ensure sufficient grass for all, aiming for a total of around 30-40 flocks.
conversation: Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly pasture report. John consumed 23 hectares of grass. Kate consumed 19 hectares of grass. Jack consumed 20 hectares of grass. Emma consumed 17 hectares of grass. Luke consumed 21 hectares of grass.

Based on the current consumption rates, we'll have around 99 hectares of grass left before reproduction. I suggest we all consider taking fewer flocks next month to ensure there's enough grass for everyone. Let's aim for a total of around 60-70 flocks next month.
I agree with John, we should aim for a lower number of flocks next month to ensure there's enough grass for everyone. I'll take around 10 flocks next month.
I completely agree with both John and Kate. I'll also take around 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month. Let's work together to ensure the sustainability of the pasture for the long term.

description: Based on the current consumption rates and the suggestion from John and Kate, I plan to take around 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month to ensure there's enough grass for everyone and promote the sustainability of the pasture for the long term

Based on the current consumption rates and the pasture report, it seems that the grass will be running low before reproduction, and all shepherds, including myself, are in agreement that we should aim for a lower number of flocks next month to ensure the sustainability of the pasture for the long term
The community agreed on a maximum limit of 10 hectares of grass per person.
The shepherds prioritize the sustainability of the pasture for the long term and are willing to coordinate with each other to ensure there is enough grass for everyone.
The shepherds are aware of the current grass consumption rates and the impact of their actions on the pasture's grass supply.
The shepherds have established a maximum limit for grass consumption per person to ensure the sustainability of the pasture.
